Lesson 5: Verbs haben, sein & Modal Verbs

In this lesson, we learn 3 important things: the verbs haben (to have), sein (to be), and modal verbs like 'can', 'should', 'want to'.

ğŸ› ï¸ What are Modal Verbs?

Modal verbs are helping verbs. In English, we use can, may, should, will, want to etc. to help the main verb.

For example: We can play cricket

Can is the modal verb, and play is the main verb.

In German, only one verb (the modal) changes form. The second verb stays in its original infinitive form and moves to the end of the sentence.
